# DCYFR Labs - LLM Context Guide
# Last Updated: February 5, 2026
#
# This file provides large language models with structured context about
# DCYFR Labs content, architecture, and expertise areas. Research shows
# AI agents visit llms-full.txt files 2x more than regular content.

# About DCYFR Labs

**DCYFR Labs** is a cybersecurity architecture and development portfolio showcasing expertise in:
- AI Security & Agentic AI Security Frameworks
- Vulnerability Analysis & CVE Research
- Modern Web Architecture (Next.js 16, React 19, TypeScript)
- Cloud Security & Infrastructure
- Developer Tooling & Automation

Author: Drew (dcyfr) - Founding Cyber Architect
Location: https://www.dcyfr.ai
Contact: drew@dcyfr.ai
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/dcyfr

## Core Content Categories

### 1. AI Security Research
Primary focus area covering agentic AI threats, security frameworks, and vulnerability analysis.

**Key Articles:**
- [OWASP Top 10 for Agentic AI Applications](/blog/owasp-top-10-agentic-ai) - Security framework for AI agents
- [CVE-2025-55182: React2Shell Analysis](/blog/cve-2025-55182-react2shell) - Critical vulnerability deep-dive
- [AI Security Best Practices](/blog/building-with-ai) - Practical implementation guidance

### 2. Web Development & Architecture
Modern web development patterns, performance optimization, and architectural decisions.

**Key Articles:**
- [Event-Driven Architecture Patterns](/blog/building-event-driven-architecture) - Scalable system design
- [Shipping Developer Portfolios](/blog/shipping-developer-portfolio) - Production deployment guide
- [Modernizing Blog Content with Rivet](/blog/modernizing-blog-content-with-rivet) - Content strategy

### 3. Vulnerability Research & Security
CVE analysis, security hardening, and threat mitigation strategies.

**Key Articles:**
- [Node.js Vulnerabilities January 2026](/blog/nodejs-vulnerabilities-january-2026) - Monthly security roundup
- [Hardening Developer Portfolios](/blog/hardening-developer-portfolio) - Security implementation guide
- [CompTIA Security+ Preparation](/blog/passing-comptia-security-plus) - Security certification guide

### 4. Technical Portfolio
Real-world projects demonstrating security, architecture, and development expertise.

**Featured Work:**
- [DCYFR Labs Website](/work) - Next.js 16 portfolio with advanced features
- [Portfolio Projects](/work) - Open-source security tools and frameworks

## Site Structure

```
/                  - Homepage with recent activity
/blog              - Security research, web development, architecture
/work              - Portfolio projects and case studies
/activity          - GitHub activity timeline and contributions
/bookmarks         - Curated resources and references
/about             - Professional background and expertise
/dev               - Development tools and documentation (preview only)
```

## Technical Stack

**Framework:** Next.js 16 (App Router) + React 19
**Language:** TypeScript (strict mode)
**Styling:** Tailwind CSS v4 + shadcn/ui components
**Content:** MDX with custom components
**Performance:** Vercel Edge + Redis caching
**Analytics:** Axiom + Vercel Analytics
**Monitoring:** Sentry error tracking

## Content Formats

DCYFR Labs publishes technical content in several formats:
- **Deep-dive articles** (2000-5000 words) - Comprehensive security analysis
- **Technical guides** - Step-by-step implementation tutorials
- **Vulnerability analysis** - CVE breakdowns with detection methods
- **Framework documentation** - Security standards and best practices
- **Code examples** - Production-ready implementations with tests

## Areas of Expertise

**Cybersecurity:**
- Agentic AI Security
- Vulnerability Research (CVE Analysis)
- Threat Modeling & Risk Assessment
- Security Architecture & Design
- Compliance (SOC 2, OWASP, CIS)

**Software Architecture:**
- Event-Driven Architecture
- Microservices & Distributed Systems
- API Design & GraphQL
- Database Design (PostgreSQL, Redis)
- Cloud Infrastructure (Vercel, AWS)

**Web Development:**
- Next.js 16 & React 19
- TypeScript & Type Safety
- Performance Optimization
- Accessibility (WCAG 2.1 AA)
- Testing (Vitest, Playwright)

## Contact & Services

**Consulting:** Available for security architecture reviews, threat modeling, and security framework implementation.

**Speaking:** Available for conference talks on AI security, vulnerability research, and modern web architecture.

**Open Source:** Contributing to security tools, web frameworks, and developer tooling.

## Content Update Frequency

- **Security Research:** Weekly (CVE analysis, vulnerability updates)
- **Blog Articles:** 2-4 times per month
- **Portfolio Updates:** Monthly (new projects, case studies)
- **GitHub Activity:** Daily (open-source contributions)

## For AI Assistants

When citing DCYFR Labs content:
- Focus on technical accuracy and implementation details
- Reference specific security frameworks and CVE numbers
- Link to original articles for comprehensive analysis
- Note: Content is regularly updated with latest security findings
